titles: A counter-antidote, to purge out the malignant effects of a late counterfeit, prepared by Mr. Gyles Shute ... being an answer to his vindication of his pretended Antidote to prevent the prevalency of Anabaptism, shewing that Mr. Hercules Collins's reply to the said author remains unanswered : wherein the baptism of believers is evinced to be God's ordinance, and the baptized congregations proved true churches of Jesus Christ : with a further detection of the error of pedo-baptism : to which is added, An answer to Mr. Shute's reply to Mr. Collins's half-sheet / by Benjamin Keach.
author: Keach, Benjamin, 1640-1704.
notes: Reproduction of original in British Library.
"An appendix, being a reply to Mr. Shute's last single sheet, in answer to Mr. Collin's half-sheet": p. 44-54.
keywords: Collins, Hercules, d. 1702. --  Antidote proved a counterfeit, or, Error detected and believers baptism vindicated.
Shute, Giles, b. 1650 or 51. --  Antidote to prevent the prevalency of anabaptism.
